cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SSE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest toward the southeast Louisiana coast, then expected to turn west and track along the Louisiana shoreline through Tuesday night
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the southeast Louisiana coast close to the mouth of the Mississippi River

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City LA to the Mississippi/Alabama border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Louisiana coast from Morgan City eastward to Ocean Springs MS and adjacent north-central Gulf Coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (39–57 mph) with higher gusts are expected Monday afternoon into Monday night.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Storm surge of 2–4 ft above ground possible along Lake Borgne and in low-lying areas of Metropolitan New Orleans.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 10 inches could cause flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents along the north-central Gulf Coast
